result.execSummary:
The defendant Lazarick L Spade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence.
Same conditions as probation except for UPFRONT condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No IN PERSON contact with victim, unless approved by the court or agent.
No Physical discipline of any minor child.

Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Cognitive Thinking class.
DNA sample previously provided, WAIVED.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
Upfront, with full Huber, NO GOOD TIME. Defendant to report by 7/17/2015 at 9:00 AM. Failure to report will result in loss of Huber and condition time, will then be served as straight time.
Probation review hearing to be set within 100 DAYS of release.

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court PRO SE. Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley NOT in court.  Owen Piotrowski for Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled so Court could  advise defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Sarah Zwach supervised by Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.  Statements from the victim's mother. Court reviewed and returned photographs.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence,  the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

*Serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, Upfront, with full Huber, NO GOOD TIME. Defendant to report by 7/17/2015 at 9:00 AM. Failure to report will result in loss of Huber and condition time will then be served as straight time.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve an additional 100 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Cognitive Thinking Class.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No IN PERSON contact with victim, unless approved by the court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No Physical discipline of any minor child.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-DNA sample previously provided, WAIVED.
-Probation review hearing to be set within 100 DAYS of release.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed:  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Sentencing Referral Form, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Received & Filed, Letter from defendant.

15RM030653  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-23-2015

Defendant Lazarick L Spade in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Lazarick L Spade in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised due to conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Court advised the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample and will have to pay the surcharge. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case rescheduled at request of the court from 1:30 PM on 5/22/2015 to 8:30 AM on 5/22/2015. Parties notified, and stipulated to change of court time.
CORRECTION: Entry of 4/16/2015, reflects corrected date of Plea & Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
